data.title: Fix a desync in GpsDot.IsTargetableBy.
data.body:
Fixes #12253, which was introduced by #11901 (Can't indirectly use `RenderPlayer` from synced code! My bad...).  The desync will occur whenever somebody has GPS and somebody else builds a gap generator or is unlucky enough to pick up a hide-map crate and then tries to target the affected building.

This is a critical priority fix (many online RA games are desyncing because of it, hooray for our super-effective playtests!), so if this is still sitting unreviewed by tomorrow night I will merge it and push a new release myself.

data.title: Nickname resets to default
data.body:
(Release-20161015)
In skirmish lobby (RA, I didn't test multiplayer lobby or other mods) player's nickname is always reset to the default one (the one in the setting)
- when you start a game
- when you alter other player slots

data.title: Move production icon sequence from Tooltip to Buildable
data.body:
Makes more sense, and saves us some `Tooltip` look-ups which also allows to make the latter upgradable more easily and regression-risk-free.

All yaml changes were done via upgrade rule, but because _all TD husk and barb wire/wood fence icon definitions were bogus_ (never caught due to lack of `SequenceReference`), only the removals were staged for the C&C mod.

Prerequisite for #11984.

data.title: Please provide an AppImage for OpenRA
data.body:
Hi,

I've noticed you provide Debian packages for OpenRA builds, but I was wondering if you could provide something that would benefit users of even more Linux distributions: an AppImage (website: https://appimage.org). AppImages are a type of cross-distribution packaging format that need not be installed in order to be run. All they need in order to be run is to be made executable (with `chmod +x`) and executed. 

Thanks for your time,
Brenton

data.title: Windows installer .NET 4.5 detection doesn't seem to work
data.body: I've seen more than one report of crashes on XP and other windows with only .NET 4.0.  The installer should be preventing these people from installing the new version in the first place.

data.title: [RA] Tanya visually appears buildable when inside pillbox/ranger/chinook.
data.body:
When Tanya is not active ON the battlefield, but rather in a transport or building, whe appears (visually) as "buildable".

Release-20161015

data.title: [d2k] there is on intro video button in missions select menu?
Cursor color does not change when using A+right click with Tanya
data.body:
I'm testing the game, playing the third mission (Dead end 1) and discovered the nice shortcut "Move + Fire" `A+Right click`. When typing `A` the cursor is expected to move from green to red but it does not work on my side for **Tanya only** (while it works for a friend of mine!):
1. If Tanya alone is selected, when typing `A` nothing happens (cursor remains green). If I still right click, she does not fire on ennemies.
2. If selecting Artillery tank, when typing `A` cursor goes red and it fire on ennemies as expected.
3. If I select Tanya and Artillery, when typing `A` cursor goes red, Artillery fires on ennemies but not Tanya.

I have tested release-20161015 on both [Windows 8.1](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/releases/download/release-20161015/OpenRA-release-20161015.exe) and [Debian](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/releases/download/release-20161015/openra_release.20161015_all.deb).

No GPU here (integrated intel HD4000).
Any idea?

seems mvcs aren't unselected like before when a next one is selected?

data.title: new full screen mode does not allow switching to other applications
data.body:
legacy full screen mode allowed you to alt+tab to other applications on Ubuntu.

full screen mode does no longer support this. 

would be good to have a way to minimize the full screen game - somehow be able to switch back to other applications again.

data.title: Split a WithAimAnimation from WithAttackAnimation and make both upgradable
data.body:
While the `With*SpriteBody`/`With*Animation` interaction might need a refactor to prevent or at least reduce conflicts between multiple animations, for now making `WithAttackAnimation` upgradable + able to handle multiple sprite bodies should be good enough for most mods.

Additionally, I split the aiming animation stuff off to its own trait, because these two aspects didn't really work properly together anyway. This also made the code cleaner and more straightforward.

A nice side-effect of the split is that `WithAttackAnimation` now only plays when the specified armament is used for attacking.

Last but not least, due to their current incompatibility with each other, a lint warning and a yaml exception when both are enabled at actor creation have been added to prevent modders from using them at the same time.

Upgrade rules, lint check and yaml exception have all been tested and worked when I tested them.

Closes #11884 (assuming #11886 is merged before this).

data.title: Fixed map import for all d2k missions
data.body:
Added 58 Templates to d2k tileset (including few neccessary duplicates) to fix OpenRA.Utility map importer.

OpenRA.Utility Map importer now imports all 39 d2k missions without tile errors!
Also changed properties of few existing tiles to represent original game behaviour.

data.body:
That means planes can't be aimed if you fly outside in my case i tryed to aim migs with my Longbows but i think this affects other aa units too. You can fly with planes outside of the map without being hit if you got some skills with them.
This is with helicopters only possible at the north i think.
See this replay at min 14 at the left side if you don't understand what i mean.
http://www.gamereplays.org/openra/replays.php?game=92&show=details&id=314762

data.title: [RA] Add faint player color to submerged units.
data.body: Mostly helpful for spectators. If the "shadow" or maybe parts of it would show off some color when submerged it would be easier to tell which unit belongs to who.

data.title: [RA] Nuke Truck ought to burn down trees in range.
data.body: Title says it all :) Would look really cool, especially if the'd burn them down in progression from ground zero.

data.title: Cash ticks don't play when the menu is opened
data.body:
#11907 moved the cash ticks to a chrome logic class that lives on a widget in the ingame-player branch of the widget tree. That part of the tree gets removed when the menu is opened, so the logic class can't tick anymore and ergo doesn't play any sounds either.

Fixing that could be as easy as moving that widget up the tree, but that might also introduce other problems.

data.title: Let the Lonestar AI use the new Sell function instead of Destroy
data.body: By the time I wrote the AI we didn't have that function. But now (as we have it) we should actually use it, I think. (As the AI "tells" the player it "sold" the walls anyway.)

data.title: [RA] Flamethrowers should explode when killed
data.body: I noticed that in the original game.

data.title: Fix for #11505
data.body: Fix for #11505 checks for valid stance now. Updated OnInside for additional disposing validation (othervise engineer would just enter and dispose)

data.title: Suggestion: OpenRA on Raspberry Pi 3
data.body: We now have experimental OpenGL driver for Raspberry Pi, so maybe we also can launch OpenRA on Raspberry Pi 3 (as it's the most powerful Pi for now)?
